text: 380px Phryne is an 1867 oil on canvas painting by Artur Grottger, now in the Czartoryski Museum in Krakow, Poland. A portrayal of the ancient Greek courtesan Phryne, who revealed her breasts before her judges to save herself from a death sentence for sacrilege, it was painted during the artist's stay in Paris a few months before his death. The subject was new to his oeuvre. == References == == Bibliography == * * * * * * * * * * category:Collection of the Czartoryski Museum category:1867 paintings category:Nude art category:Women in art category:Cultural depictions of Phryne
title: Phryne (painting)
